main event: On September 27, 1959, three lights (red, green, and white) were observed to remain in one place, with an angular shape that could not be clearly determined.
interesting points: The shapes of the lights remained static for a half-hour,An astronomer identified the lights as a planet caused by atmospheric dust,There was no sound emitted by the lights observed,The sighting was reported to the Military before the astronomer was consulted,The phenomenon was attributed to a prismatic effect.
sighted object: three lights (red, green, white) in the sky
witness description: The witness described the lights with different colors, indicating a fluorescent appearance and a lack of structural features.
